bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Jefferson Randolph Kean, April 8, 1935

div1.p: Truby writes to Kean concerning a bust of Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Jefferson Randolph Kean, April 8, 1935
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
HEADQUARTERS ARMY MEDICAL CENTER
WASHINGTON
April 8, 1935.
Brigadier General J. R. Kean,
2804 W Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Kean:
div1.p:
For the last two weeks I have been on leave most of the
time, and consequently have not been able to get in touch with you about
the bust of Walter Reed. When I returned to my desk this morning I found
your letter of April 3rd about the matter and as soon as I find time I will
call you up and we will arrange to go down to the National Museum, in ac-
cordance with our conversation on the phone. This will be a very busy week
for me so I cannot tell you exactly when I can spare the time to go with
you, however, I wont forget it and will telephone you as soon as I can about
it.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Albert E. TRUBY:
Brigadier General Medical Department. ARMY MEDICAL CENTER
OFFICIAL
(COPY)
